Description: The MoU aims to strengthen media collaboration, foster local talent, and enhance Qatar’s position as a regional media hub.

Title: US accuses Iran of supplying Russia missiles to use in Ukraine
Description: The United States said Tuesday that Iran has sent missiles to Russia for use within weeks in Ukraine and announced imminent new sanctions against Tehran

Title: Two Palestinian citizens of Israel killed in separate shootings
Description: One Palestinian man was shot dead while driving in Rahat, while another died from injuries sustained after being shot in Rosh Pina.

Title: Polio vaccine push moves to northern Gaza amid disruptions: WHO
Description: A campaign to vaccinate a final 200,000 children in north Gaza against polio began on Tuesday, despite a dire need for fuel, among other challenges.

Title: Jewish director condemns 'Gaza genocide' at Venice Film Festival
Description: US director Sarah Friedland used her acceptance speech at the Venice Film Festival, refering to the situation as ‘the 336th day of Israel’s genocide in Gaza’.

Title: In Egypt, electricity cost hikes now equal small apartment rent
Description: As electricity prices in Egypt surge to nearly match the cost of an apartment's rent, retirees and low-income families are struggling to manage their expenses

Title: Blinken in UK as allies seek way forward on Ukraine, MidEast
Description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met the new UK government on Tuesday, with the close allies expected to paper over differences on Gaza.

Title: Israel's war steals the dream of university students in Gaza
Description: Israel's ongoing war in Gaza has crushed the hopes of thousands of Palestinian students who were on the brink of graduation, leaving their futures in limbo

Title: UN polio vaccine convoy in Gaza released after Israel detention
Description: A convoy of UN vehicles detained by Israel while en roue to route to roll out the polio vaccine in northern Gaza has been released.

Title: Gaza: Children’s hair greying, falling out from shock and trauma
Description: Over 11 months of heavy Israeli bombardment on the enclave and harrowing scenes have left children debilitated by trauma and under extreme stress.

Title: Israel planning to annex north Gaza, build settlements: report
Description: An Israeli journalist paints a grim picture for the northern Gaza Strip's Palestinian residents, saying replacement awaits them.

Title: Jordan heads to polls with focus on Gaza
Description: Polls opened on Tuesday in Jordan's first parliamentary elections under a new law aimed at diluting the strong impact of tribalism.

Title: In southern Lebanon, a few hold firm against Israel's strikes
Description: I'm clinging to my land,' Hussein Karim, a 58-year-old resident, told The New Arab. 'Either I live on it, or die with it.

Title: What to expect from the Harris-Trump US presidential debate?
Description: Trump likes to dictate the terms of the debate by going off the traditional format. That's Kamala's biggest challenge,' Richard Groper remarked to TNA.

Title: Gaza agency says Israeli strike kills 40 in humanitarian zone
Description: At least 40 people killed, 60 wounded in Israeli strike on Mawasi in the Gaza Strip, Palestinian WAFA news agency says.

Title: Gaza's children receive polio vaccine as Israel's army attacks
Description: Just a few hours of receiving their doses, the Israeli army seriously wounded Hanan and Misk al-Douqi, two sisters who were displaced to Deir al-Balah city.

Description: Israel’s military conducted a missile strike early Tuesday that targeted a humanitarian area in the Gaza Strip, killing and wounding dozens of Palestinians.

Title: Iraq-KRG talks in Erbil end without deal on critical disputes
Description: Temporary decisions were made on some matters, but key topics were referred to the Iraqi Council of Ministers for further discussion.

Title: Saudi envoy to US joins Israeli officials at Washington summit
Description: Princess Reema appeared in a MEAD panel alongside the Moroccan and Bahraini ambassadors, both of whose countries signed normalization agreements with Israel

Title: Rabbi blesses soldier accused of raping Palestinian prisoner
Description: A video shows a rabbi in Israel blessing a soldier accused of raping a Palestinian detainee, defending his actions even if the soldier is to be found guilty

Title: UK to shut down Afghan embassy after Taliban warnings
Description: The UK has ordered the Afghan embassy in London, run by diplomats associated with the former government of Ashraf Ghani, to be shut down by September 27.

Title: Paramilitary gunfire in Sudan city kills at least 30 people
Description: At least 30 people have been killed after gunfire in southeastern Sudan a day after Sudan's foreign ministry rejected a UN report on the crisis.

Title: Aysenur Eygi's body to travel from West Bank to Turkey
Description: The killing of human rights activist Aysenur Ezgi Eygi by Israeli forces in the West Bank last week was met with widespread condemnation worldwide

Title: Pro-Israeli lawyers threaten UK govt over blocked arms sales
Description: UK Lawyers for Israel have threatened the British government with legal action after it suspended 30 arms export licences to Israel

Title: EU says has 'credible information' Iran sent missiles to Russia
Description: The European Union said its allies shared information that says Iran has supplied ballistic missiles to Russia, a claim Iran denies.

Title: Egypt renews 'wrongful' detention of activist held for 5 years
Description: Tens of thousands of dissidents are believed to have been jailed in Egypt, many of whom are held without trial, according to rights groups.

Title: Ex-Lebanon bank chief Riad Salameh slapped with arrest warrant
Description: Former Lebanon bank chief Riad Salameh's arrest has shaken the country, which follows a prolonged and major economic crisis.

Title: Thousands rally in Pakistan demanding for Imran Khan
Description: Thousands of protesters rallied in Islamabad, calling for Pakistan's former Prime Minister, Imran Khan, be released from prision.

Description: Mark Ruffalo has accused the US of complicity in Israel’s war on Gaza, following the deaths of an Israeli-American captive and a Turkish-American.

Title: Morocco's quake-hit villages blame slow aid on anti-Amazigh bias
Description: Despite being the Indigenous community of the region, it was only in 2001 that Amazigh culture was recognised as part of Morocco's national identity.

Title: West Bank 'under siege' by Israel after Jordan border shooting
Description: Israel announced that land crossings between the West Bank and Jordan would be closed following the shooting, stopping any trade and movement.

Title: Trump and Harris tied on eve of televised presidential debate
Description: On the eve of the presidential debate, polls show Trump and Haris are neck-and-neck in voter support.

Title: Health of jailed Jordan journalist Hassan Al-Zoubi deteriorates
Description: Jordanian journalist Ahmed Hassan Al-Zoubi was imprisoned for a social media post and now needs urgent medical attention to treat his diabetes.

Description: Nissim Vaturi, an MK from Netanyahu's Likud Party with a history of incendiary statements, has claimed Israel could attack Lebanon in the next few days

Title: Israel's Gantz says military focus needs to shift to Lebanon
Description: Israel's former war cabinet minister says the Israeli army should start focusing towards Lebanon and Hezbollah.

Title: Algeria's Tebboune re-elected president for second term
Description: Abdelmadjid Tebboune has been re-elected president of Algeria following record low election turnout.

Description: At least 18 people have been killed after Israeli airstrikes targeted the central Hama province in Syria.

Description: The Israeli army ordered more Palestinians in northwest Gaza to vacate after targeting strikes in the area.

Description: Following the vandalism of Palestinian cafe in Chicago last week, members of the tight-knit community are showing their support to the establishment.

Description: A prominent Egyptian archaeologist and former antiquities minister has launched a petition for the return of the pharaonic bust of Queen Nefertiti from Berlin

Description: Gaza's civil defence said their teams have been targeted by Israeli forces, with around 100 of them killed since October.

Title: Five Turkish-backed Syrian fighters killed by Kurdish forces
Description: Five fighters from the Turkish-allied 'Syrian National Army' have been killed in an ambush by Kurdish forces near the city of Afrin

Description: Turkey's president Erdogan was angered after military graduates took a pro-secular oath, discontinued in 2022, during their graduation ceremony

Title: At least 20,000 people killed in Sudan's war: UN official
Description: More than 20,000 people have been killed in fighting between the Sudanese army and paramilitary forces since April 2023, a senior UN official said Sunday.

Description: Reconstruction has been slow in the year since a deadly earthquake struck Morocco's High Atlas region, with only a fraction of the damaged homes rebuilt.

Description: Around 200 Syrians coming from opposition-controlled areas were detained at the Baghdad Bridge checkpoint, with their fate remaining unclear.

Title: Iran's president to visit Iraq on first foreign trip
Description: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian will visit neighbouring Iraq on Wednesday, his first trip abroad since winning the presidential election this summer

Description: Five women have escaped The Al-Hol camp, which houses thousands of displaced people, including families of ISIS fighters, following a massive fire

Description: Libya’s chief prosecutor ordered the detention of a militia leader and one of his aides, pending a probe into the killing of a notorious human trafficker.

Title: Algeria election sees low turnout as Tebboune poised for victory
Description: There was a low turnout at the Algerian presidential election on Saturday. Incumbent President Abdelmadjid Tebboune is poised to win the vote.

Title: Israeli prison guards film abuse of Palestinian detainees
Description: Israeli prison guards are taking photos and filming their abuse of Palestinian detainees, while the Israeli Prison Service says this is a 'routine exercise'

Title: Shooting kills 3 Israeli guards at West Bank-Jordan crossing
Description: Three Israeli guards were shot dead at a border crossing between the occupied West Bank and Jordan on Sunday, amid surging Israeli violence in the territory.
